title: Sanford Field
text: Sanford Field was an on-campus playing venue for <a href="American%20football">football</a> and <a href="baseball">baseball</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Georgia">University of Georgia</a> (UGA) in <a href="Athens%2C%20Georgia">Athens, Georgia</a>. It was built with wooden stands in 1911 and was named after <a href="Steadman%20V.%20Sanford">Steadman V. Sanford</a>. As a venue for football, it was replaced in 1929 by <a href="Sanford%20Stadium">Sanford Stadium</a>, which was built nearby.
